page.title: 10HOME LIFE ON A DAIRY FARM 1
page.content: THe husband rises at 6.30 a.m. to milk. His wife prepares a full cooked breakfast for around 9.00a.m.though children of school age must breakfast earlier to catch the school bus or taxi. Whilst the husband spends the morning mucking out the shippons and feeding calves and hens, his wife may do household chores, go shopping or chauffeur a pre-school child to play group in the village. She must cook the family's main meal for midday, after which she has time for socialising with friends, taking part in local activities, such as the Women's Institute, (one in Chipping, one in Whitechapel), or receiving visits from representatives of proven, mineral or medicine suppliers who usually stay for a cup of tea.
